title: The Goose Steps Out Missing Scenes Reinserted 1.02
description:
This is the one where schoolmaster William Potts (Hay) gets mistaken for, and 
takes the place of, a Nazi spy in charge of teaching would-be Nazi spies to 
blend in to British society.

The whole thing that made this film memorable was the deliberate 
misuse/mispnunciation of British place-names.

However, the DVD release that StudioCanal has been touting for the past 20 years 
or so, has those defining scenes purposely cut out ! That's right: the very 
scenes that made the film what it was, have been purposely excised, even using 
cutting room staff to provide fake transition scenes.

Some say that this cutting-down is due to an American re-release from 1961; I 
can not verify this.

I have managed to re-integrate those missing scenes from old off-air 
BBC 1980s videotape and YouTube downloads.

I've done all this using AviSynth and VirtualDub.

The quality of the VHS recordings is pretty poor and you can certainly "see the 
join" where the missing bits are reinstated.

The print from which the DVD was taken is pretty spotty too, so I've tried to 
clean-up some frames.

It runs for 1h13'42" at 24fps.

The sound could be better.

I originally did this in 2012, but the results were unsatisfactory. Hence, I am 
calling this version 1.02
